title: How to Fix Windows Update Error: 5 Troubleshooting Tips

steps.title: Before trying any fixes, restart your computer fully.
steps.content: Before trying any fixes, restart your computer fully. If you have a lot of updates backed up, some require a full restart before it can move onto the next update. Click Shut down , wait 30 seconds, and then turn on your computer again.

steps.title: Open the settings.
steps.content: Open the settings. Click the Start menu and click the cog icon.

steps.title: Click Update & Security.
steps.content: Click Update & Security . You can find this towards the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click Troubleshoot.
steps.content: Click Troubleshoot . This is next to a wrench icon.

steps.title: Click Windows Update.
steps.content: Click Windows Update . You can find this underneath the Troubleshoot header.

steps.title: Click Run the troubleshooter.
steps.content: Click Run the troubleshooter . This may take a few moments. If Windows finds any errors, it will notify you and fix them.

steps.title: Open the Command Prompt.
steps.content: Open the Command Prompt. Click the Start menu and type "cmd". Right-click Command Prompt and select Run as administrator. A System Filter Checker (SFC) scan can find problems with files on your computer. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source .

steps.title: Type DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth and press ↵ Enter . This may take a few moments to finish. Once you see The operation completed successfully , continue to the next step.

steps.title: Type sfc /scannow and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type sfc /scannow and press ↵ Enter . The scan will take a few moments. You should see Verification 100% complete when it's finished. If Windows finds any errors , you'll see the action listed below.

steps.title: Stop the Windows Update service.
steps.content: Stop the Windows Update service. Before you can delete temporary files, make sure this program is fully closed. Do the following: Click the Start menu. Type "services". Click Services . Right-click Windows Update . Click Stop .

steps.title: Navigate to This PC > C drive > Windows > SoftwareDistribution > Download.
steps.content: Navigate to This PC > C drive > Windows > SoftwareDistribution > Download . This is the path needed to find the SoftwareDistribution folder.

steps.title: Select all files in the "Downloads" folder.
steps.content: Select all files in the "Downloads" folder. You can press Ctrl + A to quickly select all files.

steps.title: Right-click the files and select Delete.
steps.content: Right-click the files and select Delete . This will delete the temporary files.

steps.title: Resume the Windows Update services.
steps.content: Resume the Windows Update services. Once the temporary files have been deleted, you can start the services again. Do the following: Click the Start menu. Type "services". Click Services . Right-click Windows Update . Click Start .

steps.title: Open the Services app.
steps.content: Open the Services app. Click the Start menu and type in "services". Click the first option. This method can fix error code 0x800700c1 .

steps.title: Select the "Startup type" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select the "Startup type" drop-down menu. This is in the General tab.

steps.title: Click Apply, then OK.
steps.content: Click Apply , then OK . The changes will be saved.
